summary: I would give you 4 immortal souls and a cookie if I can get Bakuhoe and Deku separately walking into their fem!crushes’ room...
question: I would give you 4 immortal souls and a cookie if I can get Bakuhoe and Deku separately walking into their fem!crushes’ room only to find them in their underwear. Reader doesn’t make big deal of it and just goes “you’re not like Mineta, so it’s no big deal”
answer:
Thank you for sending a request ❤️

The contract has been made, now bring me my cookie 👹

Be warned‼️ very slight (basically non) Smut/lemon‼️


Katsuki Bakugou

“Y/N! I’m sure as hell not doing cleaning duty alone!” Bakugou yells, storming towards your dorm room. A slight blush adorns his face, spending time together with you being an exciting prospect.

He knocks at your door but there’s no response. The door opens a little from the force of the knocks, making Bakugou frown at the fact it was open. Is someone in there with you? He feels his blood boil at the thought and slips through the opening of the door, closing it behind him. He’s about to shout your name again but no sound comes out of his mouth as you step foot into the room, exiting your bathroom in only your underwear.


Bakugou stumbles backwards, his blush turning 10 times darker.

You gasp as you notice him, putting a hand on your chest. “Bakugou! Why are you- Oh I totally forgot the time I’m so sorry!” You say but Bakugou’s tongue feels tied.

“I-I’ll see you downstairs.” He manages to choke out after staring at you for a solid minute. You give a him an innocent smile. “It’s alright, I’ll be done in a minute. You aren’t a pervert like Mineta.” You chuckle.

Bakugou shakes his head in shame as he is looking at you exactly like Mineta would.


The thing he doesn’t know though is that a warmth is spreading through your body and cheeks as his presence is affecting you as well.


Midoriya Izuku

Midoriya’s heart beats fast as he stands in front of your dorm room, his hand half raised for a knock. He’s been crushing on you pretty hard and tonight he decided to try to spend some time with you.

He clutches the book under one of his arms tightly, wanting to show the hero catalog to you.

Midoriya gets so excited that he forgets to knock, opening your door without warning.


Midoriya’s heart feels like it’s going to give out as he sees you standing in the middle of your room, only covered by your underwear.

You gasp loudly and put up a shirt in front of your chest, turning to face him. Your concerned facial expression drops as you see who it is, showing him a small smile. “Oh it’s you Deku. I thought you were Mineta for a moment.” You say and Midoriya quickly moves back towards the door. “I-I’m sorry! Goodnight!” He says. He freezes in surprise however when he hears you laugh. “It’s fine silly! Like I said, you aren’t Mineta, so it’s all good.” You say but Midoriya can’t help but turn beet red as he faces you again.

“What do you have there?” You ask, pointing at his book.

“A-Ah it’s the newest hero catalog.” Midoriya explains, a proud look appearing on his face. Your cheeks heat up and your heart skips a bit at how cute this is to you. “No way! That’s awesome!” You say, only making the sparkles in Midoriya’s eyes brighter.

tags: so what exactly does fandom call hawks's quirk?
I like 'mighty wings' cuz it's my kind of corny
but I just checked and the wiki calls it 'fierce wings'
and meanwhile mangastream called it 'adamantine wings' which is just plain weird
I feel like each of these ascribes certain qualities to the wings that aren't necessarily there lol
whereas 'fierce' gives the impression of some toughass wings that don't take sh*t from nobody
and 'adamantine' gives the impression that hawks had a thesaurus and wasn't afraid to use it
quirk names can be tricky things I guess
summary: BnHA Chapter 187: Keeping Up with the Todorokis
title: BnHA Chapter 187: Keeping Up with the Todorokis
body:
Previously on BnHA: My formerly-adopted-but-now-I’m-not-so-sure adult son Hawks went out for lunch with everyone’s favorite scary man and #1 trash dad (with trash not being used in the endearing way), Endeavor! They stopped a grown man from flashing his coworkers, saved the world’s dumbest dog from certain death, and signed some autographs. Eventually they actually sat down to eat, and Hawks explained that he’d been quietly investigating rumors of Noumu sightings across the country, but had yet to find any proof. He said that rumors like that tend to spread when society is fearful, and he wants Endeavor to become a number one hero that people can depend on, so that he and the other heroes can relax. At this exact moment, a fucking Noumu appeared out of nowhere and flew through their fucking window. Obviously this is not a coincidence and can’t possibly be, but I have yet to piece together exactly what’s going on. But anyways, now Endeavor is fighting this Noumu. Oh and I forgot to mention that it’s the talking Noumu with the Kurogiri face. So yeah, still wanting to know what’s up with that.

Today on BnHA: We catch up with Todoroki’s mom and two of his older siblings, Natsuo and Fuyumi. This being the Todorokis, it isn’t too long before the conversation gets melodramatic, with Natsu bringing up Endeavor’s recent #1 hero ranking. He’s not the biggest fan of his dad for obvious reasons! But in what I don’t doubt is one of the most controversial scenes Horikoshi has ever written, an oddly calm Rei says that although she doesn’t know what’s going on in Endeavor’s heart, she believes that he is trying to face his demons. So then we cut to Endeavor facing something of a literal demon. He tries to blast Talking Noumu with some fire blasts, and in response the Noumu whips him through an entire level of the building. Like he basically turns Endeavor into a human axe, with this fucking skyscraper being the tree. So that’s fun. Meanwhile Hawks keeps his cool and reveals his quirk, which gives him full telepathic control of all the feathers on his body and he can shoot them out to save people and shit. So he evacuates everyone using those, and meanwhile Endeavor tries to figure out how he’s gonna take this Noumu down.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 209 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

  • IT’S THE REST OF THE TODOROKI FAMILY OMG
  • holy shit! names and ages! first appearance of this Natsuo guy!! full disclosure, I’ve heard his name in fanfics, but I don’t know anything about him other than that he’s Shouto’s brother. and I think there’s also another brother whom everyone theorizes is actually Dabi, but I know even less about the other brother aside from the Everyone Thinks He’s Dabi thing
  • (ETA: so that’s probably because we still don’t know much about him in general! other than that his name is Touya. and that he 100% is Dabi and Horikoshi might as well stop being cute about it lol)
  • Natsuo isn’t all that much older than Shouto, huh. only a four year age difference. Fuyumi is a little bit older. makes me wonder how old the Other Brother is
  • (ETA: upon reflection, the fact that Fuyumi is three and a half years older than Natsuo makes me think that this is not a coincidence, and Endeavor basically went and made a new kid every time the previous kid’s quirk manifested until he got the desired result. so Touya is probably 3-4 years older than Fuyumi if this is the case)
  • also Rei, lovely to see you doing well. and to see your other kids visiting at long last. or did they already visit you and Shouto was the only one putting it off for so many years. well either way
  • also it’s supposedly December now, I think, so I’m surprised things are only just now starting to cool down. but then I remembered that Tokyo is quite a bit warmer than where I live, so fair enough. I just googled the average temperature for December and it seems pretty comfortable, with the highs averaging in the mid-50s (Fahrenheit)
  • anyway! Fuyumi is complaining that Natsu is never around anymore and he has a Secret Girlfriend, probably
  • wow these brothers sure aren’t much alike huh



  • Natsu doesn’t seem to have a trace of red anywhere. probably pure mom as far as quirk is concerned. although he does bear a physical resemblance to his dad, aside from the hair color and the fact that he actually smiles and has facial expressions
  • so if anything that’s another point in favor of the “Dabi is a Todoroki” theory. because we’ve got two mostly ice kids, so story-wise it would make sense if the third (and presumably oldest?) kid was a fire kid

  • and now Natsu is abruptly saying that yesterday, “he” officially became number one

  • seriously? even with his recent change of heart? is it just that he feels like an apology at this point would come off as useless at worst and self-serving at best? because that I can understand, maybe. but idk, he could at least write a letter or something. that’s not right
  • huh, Rei is saying that’s not true

  • don’t tell me he’s sending her flowers in the hospital that he put her in

  • and Rei says he’s actually visited many times but they still haven’t met face to face and that she’s too afraid
  • girl, you’re perfectly within your rights. you don’t owe him anything
  • anyways her doctor also said it was a bad idea



  • Todoroki Family Drama, everyone
  • she says she believes he’s trying to face his past and his family head on
  • and with that, we are transitioning back to the man in question

  • oh my god

  • actually I think he did something similar in the anime way back during the Hosu arc? like, I remember him running up a building. can’t remember if he flew, though. but I mean, is that even possible though? how hot would the fire have to be in order to provide thrust??

body_abstract:
Previously on BnHA: My formerly-adopted-but-now-I’m-not-so-sure adult son Hawks went out for lunch with everyone’s favorite scary man and #1 trash dad (with trash not being used in the endearing way), Endeavor! They stopped a grown man from flashing his coworkers, saved the world’s dumbest dog from certain death, and signed some autographs. Eventually they actually sat down to eat, and Hawks explained that he’d been quietly investigating rumors of Noumu sightings across the country, but had yet to find any proof. He said that rumors like that tend to spread when society is fearful, and he wants Endeavor to become a number one hero that people can depend on, so that he and the other heroes can relax. At this exact moment, a fucking Noumu appeared out of nowhere and flew through their fucking window. Obviously this is not a coincidence and can’t possibly be, but I have yet to piece together exactly what’s going on. But anyways, now Endeavor is fighting this Noumu. Oh and I forgot to mention that it’s the talking Noumu with the Kurogiri face. So yeah, still wanting to know what’s up with that.

Today on BnHA: We catch up with Todoroki’s mom and two of his older siblings, Natsuo and Fuyumi. This being the Todorokis, it isn’t too long before the conversation gets melodramatic, with Natsu bringing up Endeavor’s recent #1 hero ranking. He’s not the biggest fan of his dad for obvious reasons! But in what I don’t doubt is one of the most controversial scenes Horikoshi has ever written, an oddly calm Rei says that although she doesn’t know what’s going on in Endeavor’s heart, she believes that he is trying to face his demons. So then we cut to Endeavor facing something of a literal demon. He tries to blast Talking Noumu with some fire blasts, and in response the Noumu whips him through an entire level of the building. Like he basically turns Endeavor into a human axe, with this fucking skyscraper being the tree. So that’s fun. Meanwhile Hawks keeps his cool and reveals his quirk, which gives him full telepathic control of all the feathers on his body and he can shoot them out to save people and shit. So he evacuates everyone using those, and meanwhile Endeavor tries to figure out how he’s gonna take this Noumu down.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 209 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

Previously on BnHA: My formerly-adopted-but-now-I’m-not-so-sure adult son Hawks went out for lunch with everyone’s favorite scary man and #1 trash dad (with trash not being used in the endearing way), Endeavor! They stopped a grown man from flashing his coworkers, saved the world’s dumbest dog from certain death, and signed some autographs. Eventually they actually sat down to eat, and Hawks explained that he’d been quietly investigating rumors of Noumu sightings across the country, but had yet to find any proof. He said that rumors like that tend to spread when society is fearful, and he wants Endeavor to become a number one hero that people can depend on, so that he and the other heroes can relax. At this exact moment, a fucking Noumu appeared out of nowhere and flew through their fucking window. Obviously this is not a coincidence and can’t possibly be, but I have yet to piece together exactly what’s going on. But anyways, now Endeavor is fighting this Noumu. Oh and I forgot to mention that it’s the talking Noumu with the Kurogiri face. So yeah, still wanting to know what’s up with that.

Today on BnHA: We catch up with Todoroki’s mom and two of his older siblings, Natsuo and Fuyumi. This being the Todorokis, it isn’t too long before the conversation gets melodramatic, with Natsu bringing up Endeavor’s recent #1 hero ranking. He’s not the biggest fan of his dad for obvious reasons! But in what I don’t doubt is one of the most controversial scenes Horikoshi has ever written, an oddly calm Rei says that although she doesn’t know what’s going on in Endeavor’s heart, she believes that he is trying to face his demons. So then we cut to Endeavor facing something of a literal demon. He tries to blast Talking Noumu with some fire blasts, and in response the Noumu whips him through an entire level of the building. Like he basically turns Endeavor into a human axe, with this fucking skyscraper being the tree. So that’s fun. Meanwhile Hawks keeps his cool and reveals his quirk, which gives him full telepathic control of all the feathers on his body and he can shoot them out to save people and shit. So he evacuates everyone using those, and meanwhile Endeavor tries to figure out how he’s gonna take this Noumu down.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 209 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

[[MORE]]


  • OH SHIT HOLD THE PHONE WHAT’S THIS



  • IT’S THE REST OF THE TODOROKI FAMILY OMG
  • holy shit! names and ages! first appearance of this Natsuo guy!! full disclosure, I’ve heard his name in fanfics, but I don’t know anything about him other than that he’s Shouto’s brother. and I think there’s also another brother whom everyone theorizes is actually Dabi, but I know even less about the other brother aside from the Everyone Thinks He’s Dabi thing
  • (ETA: so that’s probably because we still don’t know much about him in general! other than that his name is Touya. and that he 100% is Dabi and Horikoshi might as well stop being cute about it lol)
  • Natsuo isn’t all that much older than Shouto, huh. only a four year age difference. Fuyumi is a little bit older. makes me wonder how old the Other Brother is
  • (ETA: upon reflection, the fact that Fuyumi is three and a half years older than Natsuo makes me think that this is not a coincidence, and Endeavor basically went and made a new kid every time the previous kid’s quirk manifested until he got the desired result. so Touya is probably 3-4 years older than Fuyumi if this is the case)
  • also Rei, lovely to see you doing well. and to see your other kids visiting at long last. or did they already visit you and Shouto was the only one putting it off for so many years. well either way
  • also it’s supposedly December now, I think, so I’m surprised things are only just now starting to cool down. but then I remembered that Tokyo is quite a bit warmer than where I live, so fair enough. I just googled the average temperature for December and it seems pretty comfortable, with the highs averaging in the mid-50s (Fahrenheit)
  • anyway! Fuyumi is complaining that Natsu is never around anymore and he has a Secret Girlfriend, probably
  • wow these brothers sure aren’t much alike huh



  • Natsu doesn’t seem to have a trace of red anywhere. probably pure mom as far as quirk is concerned. although he does bear a physical resemblance to his dad, aside from the hair color and the fact that he actually smiles and has facial expressions
  • so if anything that’s another point in favor of the “Dabi is a Todoroki” theory. because we’ve got two mostly ice kids, so story-wise it would make sense if the third (and presumably oldest?) kid was a fire kid
  • Natsu says their mom is looking very good
  • awwww!



  • I want to read Shouto’s letters so bad. they’re probably comedy gold. like reading a letter written by Data from TNG. “Dear Mother. In reference to your most recent letter, after giving the matter some thought, I acknowledge that I, as your offspring, would indeed find it amenable to ‘open up’ to you more. Therefore, in response to your request, this correspondence will include a complete record of my activities during a normal day, with particular emphasis on my perceptions of friendship”
  • I’m just kidding Shouto. I know that most days you can more or less approximate the full emotional range of a normal human being lol
  • Natsu’s plopping on his mom’s bed and says Shouto’s really dependable with those letters
  • Fuyumi says that with his supplementary classes and the dormitory system and such, he can’t come visit as often as he used to
  • yeah, I assume they have curfews at the dorms, and we know they need to get a teacher’s permission in advance to leave campus and for good reason tbh
  • but why doesn’t Shouto just text her. he’s always texting peeps, that Shouto
  • oh lol



  • so does his mom not have a phone then? they should get her one. assuming she’s allowed. which I don’t see why she shouldn’t be. I mean I’m not a psychiatrist though to be fair
  • now everyone is suddenly sitting in awkward silence for a few moments
  • and now Natsu is abruptly saying that yesterday, “he” officially became number one
  • oooooooooooooohh shit. TODOROKI FAMILY DRAMA Y’ALL



  • “the rest of us kids” oh my god. so it wasn’t just Shouto who was abused?? was it just that he got the worst of it?



  • ah, so they were more or less just neglected while knowing what was going on but being more or less helpless to do anything about it. god. that fucking sucks
  • (ETA: okay so real quick, I love the fact that this is practically the first thing out of Natsuo’s mouth in regards to his father though. “he acts like that never happened.” because it shows very clearly that Horikoshi gets it, and that he’s not just going to pretend like none of that horrific shit ever went down. it’s not just gonna be “so it turns out it wasn’t actually as bad as you remember” or “he was just misunderstood” or any of that bullshit. it was exactly as bad as they remember. Horikoshi literally gives us another quick flashback in 192 just in case anyone actually forgot. and then another flashback in chapter 203 just to be extra sure. but anyways, yeah, so this line to me reads like a promise from Horikoshi that he’s not going to be taking the easy way out here.)
  • Natsu says that after ten years Rei’s still never received an apology from him
  • seriously? even with his recent change of heart? is it just that he feels like an apology at this point would come off as useless at worst and self-serving at best? because that I can understand, maybe. but idk, he could at least write a letter or something. that’s not right
  • huh, Rei is saying that’s not true
  • Natsu’s asking why she’s defending him
  • eh?



  • don’t tell me he’s sending her flowers in the hospital that he put her in
  • okay, so she says she told him one time, around when they first met, that she liked this type of flower. and apparently he remembered
  • Fuyu is slowly putting the pieces together here and she’s all “…dad came here…!?”
  • and Rei says he’s actually visited many times but they still haven’t met face to face and that she’s too afraid
  • girl, you’re perfectly within your rights. you don’t owe him anything
  • anyways her doctor also said it was a bad idea



  • Todoroki Family Drama, everyone
  • she says she believes he’s trying to face his past and his family head on
  • and with that, we are transitioning back to the man in question



  • Todoro-kill??
  • (ETA: apparently this is an attempt at duplicating a pun that was in the original Japanese; Horikoshi used a word for “roar” which sounds very similar to “todoroki.” one of the increasingly few instances where Jaimini nailed it I think. MS just went with a literal translation and then explained the pun in a footnote lol)
  • oh my god



  • Endeavor can fly with his quirk. just like Katsuki. that makes no fucking sense, but okay
  • actually I think he did something similar in the anime way back during the Hosu arc? like, I remember him running up a building. can’t remember if he flew, though. but I mean, is that even possible though? how hot would the fire have to be in order to provide thrust??
  • mind you I am not a physicist. and it’s not like this is the most unbelievable thing that’s ever happened in this manga, and it probably won’t even be the most unbelievable thing in this chapter tbh so maybe I should just shut up
  • (ETA: later on in this chapter a man will telepathically control dozens of individual feathers to carry people to safety. feathers. so yeah, Endeavor, I’m gonna give you a pass on this one lol)
  • at any rate, at least we can take this as semi-confirmation that Shouto will also be able to fly
  • (ETA: he’s gonna have to figure out some way to balance himself, mind. support item, maybe? but I believe in him! be free little Shouto. one with the wind)
  • by the way, it really is uncanny how this Noumu attacked just the room with him and Hawks in it. the other rooms are fine, there’s not even any broken glass in any of them. he specifically targeted them. moments after they had a conversation about, you guessed it, Noumus
  • oh look the manga is Doing That Thing Again where it addresses my bitchy concerns



  • okay fine. I’LL BE QUIET
  • man this High Roller/High Spec/Whatever Noumu is creepy as hell



  • I want to hear its voice so bad. I want to know what it sounds like
  • this High Council Noumu also has human fucking fingers and it’s creeping me out soooo bad
  • Endeavor is thinking back to the Noumus he’s previously encountered, and realizing that there are differences between the types of Noumus



  • I didn’t even notice they were different colors tbh
  • and he’s thinking that if that’s the case, this one is special even within that group
  • because it can fucking talk, obviously
  • so he’s thinking to capture it alive and get information out of it
  • so now he’s launching an attack called the Brilliant Scorching Fist Hell Spider



  • that’s a lot of adjectives for what basically seems to be a few skinny fire blasts
  • holy shit I think the High Priest Noumu is swooping around behind him
  • eep



  • I can’t believe Endeavor just got fucking murdered by this High School Musical Noumu



  • fucking ouch
  • …he’s still going



  • okay serious fucking question, is he actually all right?? he just got slammed through the entire building. he’s not fucking All Might, his quirk doesn’t mitigate impacts. he’s feeling all of that
  • (ETA: for real though is his new suit made of fucking titanium or what)
  • what in the straight fuck is going on



  • I can’t follow this at all lmao
  • oh hey



  • …that’s not at all suspicious
  • oh for the love of god



  • the Todorokis might want to start thinking about what they’re going to say at their dad’s funeral



  • okay seriously
  • – wow okay but now he’s activating his flames and halting his momentum
  • shit son, you really can fly can’t you
  • so he’s a little bloodied up, but otherwise fine. this is highly unrealistic but okay!



  • oh great, the new Noumu is stronger than the current number one hero, everyone. that’s good news
  • meanwhile the top of the building is coming off oh fucking shit



  • Hawks…? little help?
  • oh my god there are people falling out this is horrifying
  • HAWKS



  • YOU BETTER SAVE THEM!
  • holy shit



  • omgggggg



  • …yep, that’d do it. launch a guy to #2 within four years of his debut, that is
  • holy shit
  • although this guy had better watch out, because Yoarashi Inasa is two and a half years away from graduation and he’s got very similar abilities as far as flying and being able to manipulate shit with his mind to save people. hell, I think he could give him a run for his money even now, honestly
  • but anyways, thanks for saving those peeps. respect
  • and now he’s blasting the Highway to Hell Noumu with some feathers too
  • and Endeavor’s taking advantage of the distraction!



  • methinks someone is a little irked at having been whipped through a building
  • oh for the love of



  • regenerating Noumus. gotta love ‘em
  • well! that’s the end of this chapter, and things aren’t looking too hot, no pun intended
  • also, just gonna come right out and say it – Hawks is acting very conspicuously shifty. like, one step shy of “aha! it was I!” scenery-chewing backstabbery. like, it’s not looking good here. All Signs Point to Evil tbh
  • but like is he a recent LoV convert then? yet another one who was influenced by Stain, perhaps? or has he been evil this entire time?? because that’s one hell of a long game if so. took four years to make it all the way to the #2 spot and then he shows his hand with a stupid move like this? I can’t help but feel like I’m still missing something here. or maybe I’m just in denial cause I love him and I don’t want him to be Secretly Evil noooo
  • (ETA: HE SCARED ME FOR A SEC but thankfully we’re good. holy shit Hawks)

Meanwhile Hawks keeps his cool and reveals his quirk, which gives him full telepathic control of all the feathers on his body and he can shoot them out to save people and shit. So he evacuates everyone using those, and meanwhile Endeavor tries to figure out how he’s gonna take this Noumu down.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 209 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)
